title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2050.2 - Designation of records access officer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2050.2 - Designation of records access officer

State Regulations
(a) The board of directors of the corporation
is responsible for insuring compliance with the regulations herein, and
designates the following person as the records access officer: The President

United Nations Development Corporation
322 East 44th Street

New York, NY 10017
(b) The records access officer is responsible
for insuring appropriate response by the corporation to public requests for
access to records. (c) The records
access officer shall assure that personnel of the corporation: (1)
maintain an up-to-date subject matter
list; (2)
assist the requester in
identifying requested records, if necessary; (3)
upon locating the records, take one of
the following actions in accordance with section
2050.5
(b) of this

Part: (i) make records available for
inspection; or
(ii)
deny access to
the records in whole or in part, and explain in writing the reasons
therefor; (4)
upon
request for copies of records, make a copy available upon payment of or offer
to pay established fees in accordance with section
2050.8
of this Part; (5)
upon request, certify that a copy of a
record is a true copy thereof; and
(6)
upon failure to locate records, certify
that: (i) the corporation does not maintain or
have possession of such records; or
(ii)
the records of which the corporation is
a custodian cannot be found after diligent search. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
2050.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
